name: picturesque
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 (especially of a place) attractive in appearance, especially in an old-fashioned way: the picturesque narrow streets of the old city
More examplesFewer examplesIt was a pretty town with a picturesque harbour and well-preserved buildings.The town itself is not especially picturesque.She lives in a very picturesque village in Suffolk.This part of the town is especially picturesque.The countryside in this region is very picturesque.

(esp. of a place) attractive in appearance: We strolled through the picturesque streets of the old city.
